blog.description:
Stoking the thirst since 2016. 
Proud tertiagenarian. Switch in every sense. 18+ only, please. I blog things that make me laugh. Or cry. Or thirst. I post in spurts, so check my archive if you want to stay abreast of my bursts of sparkling wit. I also write words about David Tennant's characters. Poetry. Original fiction. Mostly naughty. All nice.

blog.name: brandensfavoritethings
blog.title: BRANDEN'S FAVORITE THINGS
blog.description: Music, movies, television, bearded boys, & toys. These are a few of my favorite things.

title: Watch Me: Killing Eve
body:
BBC America has found their new award winning critically acclaimed series now that Orphan Black has concluded. Killing Eve is an addictive, espionage thriller, about a woman on the hunt to take down an international sociopathic assassin. 

Jodie Comer stars as Villanelle, an international assassin who’s the best at what she does. Villanelle is able to travel all over Europe killing her targets and escaping untraced, until she begins to get noticed. Villanelle is a sadistic sociopath with no allegiance to anyone, but also has a childlike innocence about her. There are moments when she reveals she just wants companionship, but she’ll also turn in a blink and kill those she once showed affection for. She’s complex which makes her fun to watch, but also terrifying. 

I’ve seen Jodie Comer before in The White Princess. It’s nice to see her again, especially in such a different role. 

Sandra Oh stars as Eve Polastri. Eve is a married mother of one, who works for British Intelligence. She’s fired after a witness she’s supposed to be protecting ends up murdered by Villanelle, but Eve refuses to give up the hunt for Villanelle and trying to stop her in her tracks. 

I never watched Sandra Oh on Grey’s Anatomy, but I loved her in my favorite comedy of 2017 Catfight! 

Villanelle develops an obsession with Eve, knowing Eve is after her. Eve reminds Villanelle of her first love, a teacher she and had an affair with in her teens. The queer appeal in the series is that Villanelle is queer, and enjoys dalliances with men and women, but seems to prefer women. Eve has a husband, but her marriage is troubled, and she seems a bit intrigued by Villanelle’s crush on her. Villanelle finds way to murder Eve’s friends, and sneak into Eve’s home, so Eve does want to stop the sadistic killer. 

My favorite character on the show is Carolyn Martens played by Fiona Shaw. Shaw is most famous for playing Petunia Dursley in the Harry Potter films. Carolyn is a boss bitch, and MI6 legend. She enlists Eve to hunt down Villanelle, after all the male operatives don’t believe Eve’s claims that the assassin is a woman. 

Carolyn has an ambiguity about her. We know there are moles in the British Intelligence, so we aren’t sure if Carolyn is friend or foe most of the time. Carolyn also has a cool cold demeanor. She never loses her cool, and always seems in control, and she’s intimidating to everyone around her, which is why I adore her. 

Killing Eve has excellent writing, is full of twists in turns, features several strong female leads, is queer, and stars a woman of color. This show has everything I love. Killing Eve definitely deserves all the accolades it’s been receiving.

summary: Unpopular Opinion: Jodie Comer Was Better Than Sandra Oh
title: Unpopular Opinion: Jodie Comer Was Better Than Sandra Oh
body:
Unpopular Opinion: Jodie Comer Was Better Than Sandra Oh

If you are unsure who Jodie Comer is, she is Villanelle in “Killing Eve.” And Sandra Oh is Eve. She was nominated for a Golden Globe and she won and made history as the first Asian-American female to win in this category. And she totally deserved it and thank you for representing us Asian-Americans! However, why wasn’t Jodie Comer nominated for her role? In this essay, I will… *spoiler alert*

(m…

View On WordPress

tags: she got it spot on though i cant argue with that
summary: Everyone after watching Killing Eve: I just can’t get Villanelle out of my head. I literally think about her all the time now. I...
body: Everyone after watching Killing Eve: I just can’t get Villanelle out of my head. I literally think about her all the time now. I think about what shes wearing, and what shes doing, and who shes doing it with. I think about the friends she has, I think about what she eats before she goes to work, and what shampoo she has, and what happened in her family. I think about her eyes and her mouth, and what she feels when she kills someone. I think about what she has for breakfast. I just want to know everything.

reblog.comment: Everyone after watching Killing Eve: I just can’t get Villanelle out of my head. I literally think about her all the time now. I think about what shes wearing, and what shes doing, and who shes doing it with.
